requirement_tested: A frontend that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: A developer setting up the project for the first time.
user_goal: Verify that the frontend successfully retrieves media content from backend APIs rather than using mock data.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Server
narrative_steps.description: Jordan runs `npm run dev` to start both frontend and backend servers concurrently after installing dependencies with `npm run install:all`.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start without errors, and the app opens in browser at development URL.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Homepage Data Fetch
narrative_steps.description: Jordan visits the homepage expecting to see real categorized ringtones and wallpapers fetched from the backend API.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage displays dynamically loaded media cards grouped by categories, confirming API integration instead of hardcoded data.

requirement_tested: A backend that connects to an external PostgreSQL database using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
user_persona: A DevOps engineer deploying the application.
user_goal: Ensure the backend properly establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sets the correct environment variables including DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc., before starting the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Set environment variables in .env file or system environment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables are correctly assigned and recognized by the backend configuration module.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Taylor starts the backend server to verify it initializes and connects to the PostgreSQL instance using the provided settings.
narrative_steps.action: Start backend server using `npm run dev` or direct node command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs show successful database connection message; no authentication or connection errors occur.

requirement_tested: Pages styled with a light goldenrod background and olive drab components
user_persona: A UI designer reviewing the site's visual consistency.
user_goal: Confirm that all pages maintain the defined color scheme throughout the site.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Homepage Styling
narrative_steps.description: Morgan navigates to the homepage to evaluate if the overall page background matches the light goldenrod color.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage and inspect body background-color.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page background is set to light goldenrod (`#FAFAD2`) across all sections.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Morgan checks various interactive components like buttons and headers to ensure they use olive drab styling.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect styles of header, buttons, and cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All primary interactive components utilize olive drab (`#6B8E23`) for borders, backgrounds, or text as appropriate.

requirement_tested: A homepage displaying categorized ringtones and wallpapers
user_persona: A new visitor exploring available content.
user_goal: Browse different categories of ringtones and wallpapers presented on the homepage.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Alex lands on the homepage and expects to immediately see organized content under distinct categories such as 'Popular Ringtones' and 'Nature Wallpapers'.
narrative_steps.action: Open homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage renders multiple category sections with relevant media cards arranged in grids.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Categories
narrative_steps.description: Alex scrolls down and clicks on a category heading to filter content specifically for that group.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a category name like 'Nature Wallpapers'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Content updates dynamically to display only items belonging to the selected category.

requirement_tested: A search bar to allow users to search for specific ringtones or wallpapers
user_persona: A user looking for something specific.
user_goal: Use the search bar to locate a particular ringtone or wallpaper by keyword.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Casey notices the search bar positioned above the main content area and decides to look for 'summer vibes' wallpapers.
narrative_steps.action: Identify and click on the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Cursor focuses in the input box with placeholder text guiding usage.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Search
narrative_steps.description: After typing 'summer vibes', Casey presses Enter to initiate the search.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'summer vibes' and press Enter key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update instantly to show media matching the query term.

requirement_tested: A category menu to filter content by type (ringtones or wallpapers) and subcategories
user_persona: A frequent user wanting to narrow down choices efficiently.
user_goal: Filter content using the category menu to view only ringtones.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Category Menu
narrative_steps.description: Jamie looks for the category filter and finds the vertical menu or collapsible icon depending on screen size.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the filter icon if on mobile, or directly interact with sidebar menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Category menu expands revealing top-level options like 'Ringtones' and 'Wallpapers'.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filter
narrative_steps.description: Jamie selects 'Ringtones' to refine the displayed items to audio files only.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Ringtones' option in the category menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Media grid updates dynamically to show only ringtones, excluding wallpapers.

requirement_tested: Individual content pages for each ringtone and wallpaper with download buttons
user_persona: A user interested in downloading a specific item.
user_goal: View details about a ringtone and proceed to download it.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Content Page
narrative_steps.description: Riley clicks on a ringtone titled 'Ocean Waves' from the homepage to go to its dedicated detail page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a media card representing 'Ocean Waves' ringtone.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a unique page for the ringtone showing large preview, description, and metadata.

narrative_steps.title: Downloading Ringtone
narrative_steps.description: On the content page, Riley sees the prominent 'Download' button and clicks it to get the file.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Download' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: File begins downloading automatically through the browser dialog.

requirement_tested: A user profile page showing download history
user_persona: An authenticated user checking past downloads.
user_goal: Review previously downloaded items through the user profile page.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Sam logs into their account using valid credentials to access personalized features.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out login form and submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully redirected to the dashboard or last visited page with profile access now available.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile Page
narrative_steps.description: Sam navigates to the profile page to check the download history section.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the user profile icon and select 'Profile'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Profile page loads showing tabs including 'Download History'.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Download History
narrative_steps.description: Sam clicks the 'Download History' tab to see a list of previously downloaded items.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Download History' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List displays entries with titles, dates, and ability to re-download.

requirement_tested: Functionality to add ringtones to a personal collection for future reference
user_persona: A logged-in user saving favorite items.
user_goal: Save a preferred ringtone to a personal collection for easy retrieval later.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Favorite Item
narrative_steps.description: Taylor discovers a ringtone named 'Morning Birdsong' and wants to keep track of it for future use.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the ringtone's individual page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page shows full details and actions for the selected ringtone.

narrative_steps.title: Adding to Collection
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the 'Add to Collection' icon next to the download button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add to Collection' button/icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Item gets added to the user's collection with a success confirmation message shown temporarily.

requirement_tested: A downloads section where users can access their downloaded items
user_persona: A returning user revisiting downloaded content.
user_goal: Re-access a previously downloaded ringtone from the Downloads section.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Downloads Section
narrative_steps.description: Jordan remembers downloading several items earlier and wants to revisit them.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Downloads' link in the main navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to Downloads page listing all previously downloaded items chronologically.

narrative_steps.title: Re-downloading an Item
narrative_steps.description: Jordan locates a specific wallpaper in the list and chooses to re-download it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the wallpaper entry.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The file initiates another download seamlessly from stored reference.

requirement_tested: A responsive navigation system to move between sections of the site
user_persona: A mobile user navigating the site.
user_goal: Effortlessly switch between site sections using the navigation menu on a smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Mobile Navigation
narrative_steps.description: On a small-screen device, Maya taps the hamburger menu icon since the horizontal nav isn't visible.
narrative_steps.action: Tap the hamburger menu icon located in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigation menu slides open vertically covering part of the viewport.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Sections
narrative_steps.description: Maya selects 'Categories' from the expanded menu to explore available content.
narrative_steps.action: Tap on 'Categories' menu item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected smoothly to the Categories page with menu closing automatically.

requirement_tested: User authentication to access personalized features like download history and collections
user_persona: New user signing up to unlock extra features.
user_goal: Register for an account and gain access to profile-based functionalities.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Registration
narrative_steps.description: Ashley arrives on the homepage and wants to register for an account to save preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Login / Register' button and choose 'Register'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Registration modal or page appears with fields for username, email, and password.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Registration
narrative_steps.description: Ashley fills out the registration form accurately and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid details and click 'Register' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created successfully, Ashley is logged in automatically, and redirected to the dashboard.

requirement_tested: A footer with links to terms of service, privacy policy, and contact information
user_persona: A visitor needing official information about the site.
user_goal: Find legal documents and contact methods via the site footer.

narrative_steps.title: Scanning Footer Links
narrative_steps.description: Leo scrolls to the bottom of any page seeking company policies and support contact.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the very bottom of the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Footer section is visible containing links for Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, and Contact Us.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Legal Document
narrative_steps.description: Leo clicks on the 'Privacy Policy' link to understand how personal data is handled.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Privacy Policy' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a standalone page detailing the site’s privacy practices.

requirement_tested: A header with logo, main navigation menu, and user login/profile access
user_goal: Quickly return to homepage and access user-specific tools using the header.

narrative_steps.title: Returning Home
narrative_steps.description: While browsing a deep category page, Jordan wishes to go back to the homepage quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Click the site logo in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Instantly redirected to the homepage without delay.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile
narrative_steps.description: Jordan wants to check recent activity and clicks the profile icon in the header.
narrative_steps.action: Click the user profile icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown menu appears offering quick links to Profile, Settings, or Logout.

requirement_tested: Category management in the backend to support organizing content
user_goal: Verify that backend supports dynamic category management which reflects on frontend.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Categories via API
narrative_steps.description: Admin uses Postman or similar tool to call `/api/categories` endpoint to retrieve current list.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/categories`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response returns structured JSON data listing all active categories and subcategories.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Frontend Reflection
narrative_steps.description: Admin confirms that changes made in backend reflect appropriately on the frontend menus and listings.
narrative_steps.action: Refresh frontend pages after backend category edits.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend dynamically updates to match latest category structure retrieved from backend.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for fetching ringtones, wallpapers, user data, and managing downloads
user_goal: Test core API endpoints to confirm they return expected responses.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Media Fetch Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Dev sends a request to the `/api/media` endpoint to fetch sample media items.
narrative_steps.action: Make GET request to `/api/media` endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns paginated list of media objects with titles, URLs, and metadata in JSON format.

narrative_steps.title: Testing User Profile Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Dev accesses protected `/api/user/profile` route with valid auth token to retrieve user info.
narrative_steps.action: Include JWT in Authorization header and send GET to `/api/user/profile`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Responds with authenticated user’s profile data including ID, name, and email.
